concept.title: Getting started with graph databases - GraphML
concept.shortdesc: Getting started with graph databases - GraphML.

conbody.p: Graph databases are useful for discovering simple and complex relationships between things. These things can be people, software, locations, automobiles, or anything else you can think of. Relationships are fundamental to how humans interact with one another and their environment.
Graph databases consist of two elements: nodes and edges. Nodes are objects, such as people or artifacts. Edges define the relationships between nodes.

Elements are labelled to distinguish the type of nodes and edges in a graph database. A node that will hold information about people can be labelled person. An edge in the graph could be labelled relatedBy.

Simple graphs consist of nodes that have properties. For instance, a person node generally will have a name. Age, birthday, birthplace, and job title are all examples of properties of a person node. Edges can also have properties. A relatedBy edge can have a relationship property that identifies if the adjoining node is a mother, sister, aunt or cousin.
